function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Less accurate antigen rapid tests (ARTs) may lead to false negative results, allowing infected individuals to go undetected.","Impact":"Undetected infections can lead to further spread of contagious diseases within the community.","Mitigation":"Usage of more accurate testing methods and confirmation of results with other diagnostic techniques.","Technologies":"More accurate diagnostic tools such as RT-PCR tests.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, and public health organizations.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities, public health organizations, and regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Invasive and uncomfortable nature of RT-PCR tests and ARTs may discourage individuals from getting tested, leading to undiagnosed cases.","Impact":"Undiagnosed cases can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases and delay necessary treatment.","Mitigation":"Development of non-invasive and user-friendly testing methods, as well as awareness campaigns to educate the public about the importance of testing.","Technologies":"Non-invasive testing methods such as wearable devices for continuous monitoring.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, and public health organizations.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities, public health organizations, and technology developers."},{"Description":"Lack of continuous monitoring and automation in detection methods may result in delayed identification of infections and transmission of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Delayed identification can lead to increased transmission and difficulty in controlling the spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Implementation of continuous monitoring and automated detection methods using wearable devices and other advanced technologies.","Technologies":"Wearable devices for continuous monitoring, predictive analytics, and real-time data transmission.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, and public health organizations.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities, public health organizations, and technology developers."},{"Description":"Minimal involvement from users and healthcare professionals in wearable technology may lead to reliance on technology and potential negligence of other diagnostic and preventive measures.","Impact":"Overreliance on technology may result in overlooking traditional diagnostic methods and preventive measures, leading to undetected cases and increased transmission of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Comprehensive education on the role of wearable technology as a complement to traditional methods, as well as continued emphasis on the importance of holistic approach to healthcare.","Technologies":"Holistic healthcare management systems that integrate wearable technology with traditional diagnostic and preventive measures.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, and public health organizations.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities, public health organizations, and educational institutions."},{"Description":"Rapid proliferation of wearable technology in the healthcare sector may lead to concerns regarding data privacy and security, leading to potential misuse or unauthorized access to sensitive health information.","Impact":"Potential breaches of data privacy and security can compromise the confidentiality and integrity of individuals' health data, as well as erode public trust in healthcare technology.","Mitigation":"Implementation of robust data privacy and security measures, adherence to regulatory guidelines, and transparent communication with users about data protection and consent.","Technologies":"Data encryption, secure data storage, and compliance with healthcare data privacy regulations.","People":"General population, healthcare workers, researchers, and technology developers.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities, technology developers, and regulatory bodies."}]}
